qas.question: Whose definition of identity closely follows Erikson's?
One person's perception of another's perception is an example of what concept?
The person, aspects of self, and personal characteristics displayed to others are components of what?
Whose definition of identity closely follows Liang's
What concept is one person's perception of their own perception and example?
What term includes characteristics displayed towards others?

plausible_answers.text: the past, present and future components of the experienced self

qas.question: What components of the experience itself did Erickson emphasize?
What is help others view you an important part of?

context: <a0_0>Laing's<a0_0/> definition of identity closely follows <b3_0>Erikson's<b3_0/>, in emphasising <b6_0>the past, present and future components of the experienced self<b6_0/>. He also develops the concept of the "<a1_0><b4_0><b7_0>metaperspective of self<b7_0/><b4_0/><a1_0/>", i.e. the self's perception of the other's view of self, which has been found to be extremely important in clinical contexts such as anorexia nervosa. (Saunderson and O'Kane, 2005). Harré also conceptualises components of <a2_0><b5_0>self/identity<b5_0/><a2_0/> – the "person" (the unique being I am to myself and others) along with aspects of self (including a totality of attributes including beliefs about one's characteristics including life history), and the personal characteristics displayed to others.
